Dear Tia M. Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/13/24, Staff 1 hit Youth A on their body during a verbal
altercation. There were no observed injuries. Staff 1 has been
suspended.
Investigation Director was contacted via telephone on 10/14/2024. Director
confirmed there was an incident involving Staff 1 and Youth A.
Staff 1 has been put on administrative leave pending the
investigation. Youth A was examined by Doctor and no injuries
reported.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 10/18/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the
facility for 7 months. Youth A reported on the morning of
10/13/2024, he was upset because the television was on, and
they are not supposed be watching television. He went and
unplugged the cable box, and that’s when Staff 1 told him, why
was he questioning her decision and to put the “fucking cable box
down.” He and Staff 1 started to argue, and she got in his face, so
he told her to “get fuck away from him.” He said Staff 2 told Staff 1
to leave the pod, but Staff 1 continued to argue with him and that
triggered him to follow her in the hallway. He said Staff 1 grabbed
his hair and hit him in the face. He didn’t want to hit her because
he does not hit women, but Staff 1 hit first. Staff 3 and Staff 4
separated them, and he returned to the pod.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 10/18/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 was working with
Staff 1 on 10/13/2024. Staff 2 reported they usually do social skills
in the morning before youths can watch television, so Youth A was
trying to turn the television off and that’s when Staff 1 got mad at
2

Youth A. He has a good rapport with Youth A and was trying to
de-escalate Youth A, but Staff 1 kept arguing with Youth A. Staff 2
told Staff 1 to leave the pod, but she stood at the door and she
and Youth A were going back and forth. Staff 2 said Staff 1 did
cuss at Youth A and he did witness Staff 1 swing at Youth A. He
did separate them and that’s when Staff 1 left the pod and Youth
A followed her. He said Staff 3 and Staff 4 came and assisted,
they removed Staff 1 and Youth A returned to the pod.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B recalled the
incident involving Youth A and Staff 1. He said Staff 1 told him he
can watch television and Youth A was mad that he was one that
had the remote control, so Youth A unplugged the cable box. Staff
1 told Youth A he is not the king of the pod. Youth B said Youth A
told Staff 1, “Bitch I will smack you.” He said Youth A went up to
Staff 1 and that’s when Staff 1 put her hands up. He said Staff 2
stood between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth B reported Youth A is
easily triggered when he does not get his way and will get
aggressive. He did not witness Staff 1 hit Youth A, but did see
Youth A run after Staff 1 when she left the pod.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C denied hearing or
witnessing the incident between Staff 1 and Youth. He said Staff 1
is by the book and is very stern when it comes to following the
rules. He denied any previous incidents involving Staff 1 cussing
or getting physical with any of the youths on the pod
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a Youth Specialist
and has worked at the facility for six months. She completed all
new hire training including Mandt system de-escalation training.
Staff 1 reported on the day in question Youth A was upset
because the television was on, so Youth A unplugged the cable
box. She approached Youth A and Youth A threatened to hit her
and called her the “B” word. She admitted that she also called him
the “B” word and put her hands to stop him from hitting her. She
said Youth A swung at her and she hit him back and pulled Youth
A’s hair. Staff 1 said she was instructed to leave the pod, but she
didn’t want to leave Staff 2 alone on the pod. Staff 1 admitted that
she made a mistake and should not have hit Youth A. Staff 1
became very emotional and cried during the interview.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported he
3

responded to a call to assist with an incident on Pod D. When he
approached the pod, he witnessed Staff 1 and Youth A in the
hallway arguing. He got between them and attempted to keep
them from getting into a physical altercation, Staff 4 arrived and
assisted by escorting Staff 1 away from Youth A, but Staff 1
continued to attempt to grab at Youth A. Staff 4 eventually got
Staff 1 to walk away and removed her from the area. Staff 3 said
Youth A and Staff 1 were cussing at each other using the “B”
word. He denied witnessing Staff 1 hit Youth A, but she was trying
to grab at Youth A. He said Staff 1 is a very stern worker and has
never observed her react the way she did in this situation.
Staff 4 was interviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 reported he was in
the control room during this incident and had instructed Staff 1 to
leave the pod, over the intercom. He went to assist and when he
arrived Staff 3 was in the hallway with Staff 1 and Youth A trying
to keep Staff 1 from charging at Youth A. Staff 1 was still trying to
get to Youth A, he intervened and escorted Staff 1 away from
area. Staff 4 said Staff 1 should have left the pod when she was
instructed to leave.
Director was interviewed via telephone on 11/22/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Director reported that Staff 1
has been terminated and is no longer employed at Lincoln Center.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage reviewed at the facility on 10/28/2024. Video date
10/13/2024 at approximately 9:40 am (note: video has no audio).
Staff 1 was standing by the door and appeared to be agitated and
pointing at Youth A, Staff 2 was standing by Youth A and
appeared to be talking to Youth A. Staff 1 and Youth A appeared
to be going back and forth arguing. Staff 1 left the pod and that’s
when Youth A followed her off the pod. Staff 2 attempted to block
Youth A from following Staff 1. Youth A was observed swinging at
Staff 1 and Staff 1 was seen hitting Youth A in the face, as Staff 3
and Staff 4 arrived at the scene and separated Youth A and Staff
1. Staff 4 escorted Staff 1 away and Staff 3 is seen talking to
Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 10/13/2024 noted: Youth A was
displaying negative behavior and failed to follow staff’s
4

directives. Staff 1 continued to redirect Youth A resulting in
a verbal altercation between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A
became aggressive towards Staff 1, so Staff 2 attempted to
verbally redirect Youth A. Staff 1 assaulted Youth A by
smacking him in the face. Youth A charged at Staff 1 and
smacked her in the face. Staff 3 and Staff 4 arrived on the
scene and removed Staff 1 from the scene.
• Staff 1’s personnel file; there was no disciplinary record.
She completed Mandt system verbal de-escalation training
on 08/30/24.
• Facility youth and discipline and behavior management
policy prohibits any type of physical discipline.
Analysis The Facility is found in non-compliance per interviews with Staff,
Youth, and documentation reviewed, Staff 1 did hit Youth A on the
face and used derogatory language.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE: Technical assistance was offered to
the facility regarding updating the Discipline & Behavior
Modification policy to ensure all of the prohibited forms in the rule
and subsections are outlined in their policy.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
